info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:38PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central El Paso County through 215 PM MDT... At 137 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Peyton, or 22 miles northeast of Colorado Springs. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain could cause localized flash flooding of roads, creeks and low water crossings. Locations impacted include... Peyton and Black Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
